author: Madurai Bureau
text:
Members of Tamil Nadu Association of All Types of Differently Abled Caregivers staged a protest here on Friday and courted arrest pressing a six-point charter of demands.

Led by their association State secretary Abdul Najimudhin, they staged the protest in front of the union office by squatting on the road and disrupting traffic. They were arrested for defying police orders and detained in a marriage hall and released in the evening.

They staged the protest as part of a State-wide agitation, pressing a charter of six demands, including financial assistance for those who had 40 per cent disability, increasing the assistance to Rs. 5,000, and implementation of three per cent reservation in government jobs after appointing an enquiry commission headed by a sitting High Court judge.

Palani

Thirty different abled persons, including 10 women, were arrested for picketing the Dindigul Road in Palani on Friday. They condemned the death of a differently abled person during a strike and the “adamant attitude of the government in not giving various concessions even after a High Court direction.”
title: Differently abled persons stage protest in Ramanathapuram
